column4: hi all, i got a question. I did apt-get install kubuntu-desktop and now the boot splash and grub background is blue and it says booting kubuntu but i want it back to ubuntu how do i do that?
you can do it more easily than that:
that will give you a question "Make GDM default?" Say Yes
gdm is allready the manager i have at login screen
the package for that is plymouth-theme-kubuntu-logo (on natty), there should be an equivalent package in older ubuntus, removing it will return you to the default bootsplash
do 'apt-cache search kubuntu|grep boot' to find it
you're welcome, did you identify a package for the kubuntu boot splash on your system?
i didsudo apt-get install --reinstall plymouth-theme-ubuntu-logo plymouth-theme-ubuntu-text
k feel free to pm me if it doesnt work, i'm on natty/kubuntu as well
i gotta reboot now th en
